summary: REQ-10 is implemented in both backend and frontend by removing the ‚Äú_COIN‚Äù suffix and using the username directly as the per-user asset symbol. Backend per-user asset metadata strings were updated to avoid obvious crypto jargon (e.g., no " Coin" suffix / no emoji in the shown metadata). However, the anti-impersonation/name-claim requirements (REQ-9) are only partially implemented on the frontend and are not evidenced as persisted/enforced in the backend, and some user-facing copy still contains crypto-trope emojis (üöÄ) which conflicts with the ‚Äúavoid crypto jargon/tropes‚Äù requirement (REQ-11).

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend persists additional profile metadata needed for name-claim/verification status (e.g., a claimed-name confirmation flag and any supporting fields).
missing_requirements.reason: The backend UserProfile type shown only contains username/displayName/bio, with no persisted name-claim fields evidenced.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend enforces at least one concrete anti-impersonation rule at write time (e.g., claimed display name uniqueness across all users or preventing claimed-name changes after initial creation), returning a clear error when violated.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff does not show any write-time enforcement of an anti-impersonation rule (the createCallerUserProfile implementation is truncated and no such checks are evidenced elsewhere).

missing_requirements.requirement: UI surfaces the user‚Äôs current name-claim/verification status in the authenticated area (e.g., in the profile section) in plain English.
missing_requirements.reason: The provided DashboardPage/AppShell snippets do not show a verification/status indicator; the file summary mentions it, but the diff evidence shown is truncated before any such badge/text appears.

missing_requirements.requirement: During first-time profile setup, the user must complete an explicit name-claim step (e.g., checkbox + short statement) before profile creation can be submitted, and backend persists/records that claim.
missing_requirements.reason: The modal requires a local `nameConfirmed` boolean to submit, but the mutation payload only sends username/displayName/bio, so the backend cannot record the claim state from the shown code.

missing_requirements.requirement: Remove/avoid crypto jargon and crypto tropes across user-facing copy (landing page, profile setup, dashboard, coins list, coin detail/order book).
missing_requirements.reason: At least two key screens still use the rocket emoji (üöÄ), which is explicitly called out as a crypto trope in the requirement examples.
